intro: Montiopsis potentilloides, commonly known as the desert sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with small, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is well adapted to dry conditions, with succulent leaves that store water and reduce transpiration. Montiopsis potentilloides is often found in sandy or gravelly soils, thriving in full sun.
